Activity: Boot up, check emails. See if @Ricardo and @Fatima have replied. Maybe browse Reddit's r/gamedev for interesting discussions.

Schedule a meeting with @Ricardo and @Fatima to discuss their workflows, software, and address any initial concerns they might have regarding the preliminary tech requirements. Subject: Meeting Request - 3D Asset Workflow and Tech Requirements.

Meeting with @Ricardo and @Fatima. Deep dive into the 3D modeling and animation pipeline. Discuss potential bottlenecks and optimization strategies. Take detailed notes and adjust the tech requirements document accordingly.
Lunch break. Maybe grab something quick from the cafeteria and browse some tutorials on advanced rigging techniques.
Begin refining the technical requirements document based on the feedback from @Ricardo and @Fatima. Pay special attention to the animation frame rate and its impact on performance.

Email @Mei (UI/UX Designer), @Aisha (UI/UX Designer), @Javier (UI/UX Designer) and @David (UI/UX Designer). Subject: UI Element Technical Considerations. Introduce myself and set up a brief introductory meeting to discuss UI asset creation and integration into the game.
Research best practices for optimizing UI assets in a third-person shooter. Focus on minimizing draw calls and texture memory usage. Check out some Unreal Engine documentation.
Wrap up for the day. Review the refined technical requirements document. Make sure it's clear and concise. Prepare for the UI meeting tomorrow.
